meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: 10 Years of Lazio Taxes After weeks of declining to release his income tax returns, Representative Rick A. Lazio offered a limited glimpse at his records, and his finances looked ordinary.

Burundi Peace Talks Flag President Clinton arrived in Tanzania, where he had hoped to witness signing of a deal to end Burundi's civil war. But he used the occasion to plead for peace after some of the parties refused to sign.
10 Years of Lazio Taxes After weeks of declining to release his income tax returns, Representative Rick A. Lazio offered a limited glimpse at his records, and his finances looked ordinary.

Burundi Peace Talks Flag President Clinton arrived in Tanzania, where he had hoped to witness signing of a deal to end Burundi's civil war. But he used the occasion to plead for peace after some of the parties refused to sign.

Woodstock Revisited Gov. George E. Pataki announced plans for New York to finance about $15 million of the cost of a $40 million performing arts and music center in Bethel, the site of the Woodstock festival in 1969.
Mets Tie Braves for First The Braves lost in Atlanta and the Mets defeated the Astros, 4-2, at Shea Stadium to share first place for the first time since the opening week of the season.
New Drug Tests at Olympics The International Olympic Committee's executive board approved plans to carry out tests for the banned synthetic hormone known as EPO at next month's Summer Games.

Rising Water Imperils Venice An American archaeologist studying the origins of Venice has found clues suggesting that a multibillion-dollar plan to build floodgates to save the city from rising waters is doomed.
